meaningMnemonic:
If you <kanji>untie</kanji> something that's <kanji>frozen</kanji>, you're <vocabulary>thawing</vocabulary> it. The best way to go about <vocabulary>defrosting</vocabulary> anything is always to untie it first.

In the context of computer files, this word can also mean <vocabulary>unzipping</vocabulary>. We unzip files in English, but in Japanese we thaw them!
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi for both kanji, so you should be able to read this one on your own.
